Administration.text:
Type: SNRI
Dosage Forms:
Routes of Administration:
Common Trade Names: Cymbalta

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: C
Lactation risk: infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing: avoid use if CrCl <30 mL/min
Hepatic dosing: Avoid use in hepatic impairment

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
MAOI use concomitantly or within past 14 days

Serious.text:
Hypertensive crisis
Orthostatic hypotension
Myocardial infarction
Serotonin syndrome
Withdrawal syndrome
GI bleed
SJS
Suicidal thoughts
Liver failure

Common.text:
Nausea, anorexia, constipation, diarrhea, xerostomia
Dizziness, fatigue/somnolence, insomnia
Headache
Hypertension

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 8-17h
Metabolism: Hepatic, CYP1A2 and CYP2D6
Excretion: Mostly renal

Mechanism_of_Action.text: Selectively inhibits reuptake of serotonin and norepinephrine
